entry.title: How can I query bank details with the MainBankIndicator feature?
entry.content: I managed to set the MainBankIndicator to true using the manageEmployeeIn2 SOAP service. So it works. What I'm missing is how to read this feature. QueryEmployeeBankDetailsIn contains the bank information, but not the MainBankIndicator, and QueryEmployeeIn does not contain any bank information. Does anyone have any ideas?

entry.title: OData V4 Delta Token (@odata.deltaLink) not returned for CDS View with ODP
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am facing an issue with enabling delta extraction for an OData V4 service built on top of a CDS View. Despite the backend configuration appearing correct and the delta mechanism working with test tools, the OData service does not return the @odata.deltaLink.

I would appreciate any insights or suggestions.

System Information:

SAP S/4HANA ON PREMISE 2021

Release: 01 (02/2022) FP

CDS View Definition
I have created a custom CDS view with a C1 release contract, which is enabled for data extraction and delta handling via ODP.

Here is the code for the CDS view:

@AbapCatalog.sqlViewName: 'ZDELTATEST'
@AbapCatalog.compiler.compareFilter: true
@AbapCatalog.preserveKey: true
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Delta Test'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@AnalyticalQuery: true
@ODQ.enabled: true
@Analytics: {
    dataCategory: #FACT,
    dataExtraction: {
        enabled: true,
        delta: {
            byElement: {
                name: 'LastChangeDateTime'
            }
        }
    }
}
define view ZC_DELTA_TEST
  as select from I_SalesDocument
{
  key SalesDocument,
      SDDocumentCategory,
      SalesDocumentType,
      SalesDocumentProcessingType,
      CreatedByUser,
      LastChangedByUser,
      CreationDate,
      CreationTime,
      LastChangeDate,
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.lastChangedAt: true
      LastChangeDateTime,
      LastCustomerContactDate
}


2. OData V4 Service Exposure
The OData service was created using the standard ABAP RAP approach:

A Service Definition was created to expose the CDS view.

A Service Binding of type OData V4 - UI was created and published.

The service is active and can be called successfully for full data extraction.

3. Successful Backend Delta Test
The delta mechanism for the underlying ODP provider works correctly.

Using the report RODPS_REPL_TEST, I was able to perform an initial full extraction (F mode) and a subsequent delta extraction (D mode), which correctly returned only the changed records.

In transaction ODQMON, I can see the corresponding delta queue for the ODP, and the requests from RODPS_REPL_TEST are visible and processed correctly.

4. The Problem: No Delta Link in OData Response
The issue occurs when calling the OData V4 service from an external client (e.g., Postman).

The request is sent with the required header: Prefer: odata.track-changes

The service responds with a 200 OK status and the full data set.

However, the response payload does not contain the @odata.deltaLink, which is necessary for subsequent delta calls.

No new subscription for the OData consumer appears in ODQMON after the call.

It seems there is a breakdown in communication between the OData V4 service layer and the underlying ODP framework, preventing the delta subscription from being created.

Has anyone encountered a similar issue on this S/4HANA version or has any idea what configuration step or authorization might be missing specifically for the OData V4 delta token mechanism?

Thank you in advance for your help.

entry.title: patch/create Account Assignment M for a existing Purchase order in S/4Hana Public Cloud
entry.content:
hello there lovely SAP Community, 

 

id like to create a Account Assignment "M" with a reference for a Sales Order and Sales Order item for an already existing Sales order. it needs to be done with a Odata API. 

 

Currently im Struggling with that on Item level a Update on Item lvl needs to be done to Change AccountAssignment Category to "M" and on Account Assingment lvl a Account assingment needs to be Created. 

 

Kinda Like: 

 

A Patch on item lvl. 

 

{
"AccountAssignmentCategory": "M",
      "_PurOrdAccountAssignment": [
        {
          "PurchaseOrderItem": "10",
          "AccountAssignmentNumber": "1",
          "SalesOrder": "335",
          "SalesOrderItem": "000100"
}
]
 
 
}
 
i cant get it work. 
 
Problem: on Item lvl its kinda a Patch of AccountAssignmentCategory... but on Account assignment lvl its a create.
 
So my Question: How to Create a Account Assignment on a already existing Purchase Order via Odata. 
 
kind regards, 
Philipp

entry.title: During OData call, system terminates with short dump RAISE_SHORTDUMP.
entry.content:
RAISE_SHORTDUMP (/BOBF/CX_FRW_FATAL) during SYCM project validation ‚Äì RFC system failure in destination ZCA100WILP3PWN3IP5BLH33WRVHQCATM

Hello Experts,

I‚Äôm facing a runtime error while executing an OData operation related to SYCM/ATC project validation.

Error Details:
- Runtime Error: RAISE_SHORTDUMP
- Exception: /BOBF/CX_FRW_FATAL
- Business Object: SYCM_APS_I_PROJECT
- Application Component: BC-DWB-TOO-ATF
- Message: ‚ÄúSys failure in dest. ZCA100WILP3PWN3IP5BLH33WRVHQCATM‚Äù

ST22 Analysis:
The dump indicates that the BOPF framework raised a short dump due to a fatal error in the class `CL_SCA_DS_REMOTE_CONNECTION` during validation (`VALIDATE_PROJECT`).
Root cause seems to be an RFC system failure when calling the remote destination above.

What I‚Äôve checked so far:
- Confirmed that this happens during a SYCM/ATC project validation (possibly remote check configuration).
- I've checked RFC connection via SM59 and it's working.
- OData error log (ST22) shows the same failure message.
- Suspect the RFC destination or remote ATC system is unavailable or misconfigured.

Questions:
1. What is the recommended way to validate or correct the SYCM/ATC remote connection setup for SYCM_APS_I_PROJECT?
2. Is there a standard configuration path or report to test the connection used by SYCM validation?
3. Could this be caused by an inactive or obsolete ATC remote system configuration, and if so, where should that be maintained?
4. Are there known SAP Notes or corrections related to `/BOBF/CX_FRW_FATAL` in SYCM or ATC validation contexts?

Any guidance or experiences resolving this type of RFC failure in SYCM project validation would be greatly appreciated!
@Olga @olgaolga

entry.title: OData Delta extract failing with error RSODP_ODATA042.
entry.content:
Dear Sap Community

We are facing an issue with one custom Delta Extract service where it works for Full extract but after a few delta extracts, it starts failing with error RSODP_ODATA042. 

Full Error message:

Failure happened on 'Source' side. ErrorCode=ODataRequestNotSucceeded,'Type=Microsoft.DataTransfer.Common.Shared.HybridDeliveryException,Message=Requesting response from path DeltaLinksOfFactsOfZEWM_PROD_NEW('D20251113231117_000041000')//ChangesAfter and query $filter=&sap-client=400 failed with status code BadRequest and message <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><error xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/ado/2007/08/dataservices/metadata"><code>RSODP_ODATA/042</‚Ä¶ xml:lang="en">S:RSODP_ODATA:042</message><innererror><application><component_id/><service_namespace>/SAP/</service_namespace><service_id>ZEWM_PROD_MASTER_ODP_NEW_SRV</service_id><service_version>0001</service_version></application><transactionid>D8C8D15E33990390E006919C91406949</transactionid><timestamp>20251116224624.6897370</timestamp><Error_Resolution><SAP_Transaction>For backend administrators: run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details</SAP_Transaction><SAP_Note>See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis

 

We have tried to create new CDS/Service as well and face same issue again. Also, the message RSODP_ODATA042 does not exists in our EWM system yet where this service call is failing. If we do a Full extract again which resets the Delta counter, it again works for a few times for delta extract before again failing with same error.

entry.title: OData Service: ‚ÄúNo system alias found for service‚Äù after transport to QA ‚Äì why is ‚ÄúLOCAL‚Äù missing?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôve created an OData service that reads data from a custom table and provides PDF downloads. Everything is fully implemented and working in our development system (DEV). The service also runs fine in the Gateway Client (/IWFND/GW_CLIENT).

After transporting it to QA, I‚Äôm getting the following error in the Gateway Client:

500 ‚Äì No system alias found for service

When I checked the service in QA via /IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE, I noticed that there is no system alias ‚ÄúLOCAL‚Äù defined at all.

This confused me because in DEV the service is assigned to the alias ‚ÄúLOCAL‚Äù, but in QA it doesn‚Äôt exist.

What also makes it strange:

Other OData services in QA and PROD are working fine‚Äîeven though they also don‚Äôt have any system alias assigned. So the system somehow works without explicitly having ‚ÄúLOCAL‚Äù configured.

My questions:

Why does ‚ÄúLOCAL‚Äù exist in DEV but not in QA/PROD?

Shouldn‚Äôt this be consistent?

How is it possible that other OData services work without any system alias at all?

Is the system using some kind of implicit local alias?

What is the correct way to fix this issue for my new OData service?

Do I need to create the alias manually in QA, or is there a better approach?

How can I make sure that existing productive OData services won‚Äôt be affected by this configuration?

entry.title: Introduction to API in SAP ABAP
entry.content:
Introduction to REST APIs in SAP ABAP ‚Äì A Beginner-Friendly Guide

In today‚Äôs digital landscape, integration is at the heart of every business process. Whether it‚Äôs connecting SAP with e-commerce platforms, CRMs, payment gateways, or cloud applications‚ÄîAPIs play a crucial role in making systems communicate smoothly and securely.

As SAP evolves, an ABAP developer is no longer limited to classical reports and enhancements.

We now work in a world where REST APIs, JSON payloads, and HTTP calls are becoming everyday essentials.

This blog marks Part 1 of my API Series for SAP Developers, where I break down core API concepts in simple words, along with how they relate to SAP ABAP.

What is an API? 

  • API stands for Application Programming Interface‚Äîa structured way for two systems to communicate.

Think of an API as a messenger that carries a request from one system and brings back a response from another.

For example:

  • SAP retrieving live weather details from a weather API
  • SAP sending order data to a third-party logistics system
  • SAP fetching exchange rates from an external service

Understanding REST and RESTful APIs

  • REST (Representational State Transfer) is an architectural style that defines how systems interact using simple, lightweight standards‚Äîusually over HTTP.

A REST API follows these REST principles and works on the basis of:

‚û°Ô∏è A Request sent by the client

‚û°Ô∏è A Response returned by the server

This makes REST APIs fast, scalable, and widely used.

Structure of an API Request

A typical API request consists of four key elements:

1. Endpoint

  • The URL where the request is sent.

Example: /weather/data/city=Berlin

2. Method (HTTP Verb)

  • Defines the action to perform.

Method Purpose:

  1. GET Retrieve data
  2. POST Create new data
  3. PUT Replace/update full data
  4. PATCH Update partial data
  5. DELETE Remove data

3. Headers

  • Used for authentication (API key, bearer token) and metadata (content type, encoding).

4. Body (Payload)

  • The actual data being sent‚Äîusually JSON or XML.

Example (JSON):

{

  "city": "Berlin",

  "unit": "celsius"

}

Prerequisites in SAP to Consume an API:

  • Before calling an API from SAP ABAP, ensure:
  • ‚úî SICF Service is Active
  • SAP uses ICF (Internet Communication Framework) for HTTP/HTTPS calls.
  • Transaction: SICF
  • ‚úî Required Authorizations
  • Your user should have permissions for:
  • Making HTTP calls
  • Accessing destinations
  • Using classes like CL_HTTP_CLIENT

How SAP ABAP Communicates with APIs:

API provides robust classes to make HTTP calls:

  • CL_HTTP_CLIENT ‚Äì Create and send requests
  • IF_HTTP_CLIENT ‚Äì Handle and process responses

With these, you can:

‚úî Send GET/POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE calls

‚úî Send JSON/XML body

‚úî Read and parse JSON responses

‚úî Connect SAP to external cloud services

This opens doors to integrations like:

  •  Fetching weather data
  • Connecting to payment gateways
  • Sending delivery data to logistics providers
  • Communicating with AI/ML APIs

Example Use Cases for APIs in ABAP

Here are some real-world scenarios where ABAP developers use APIs:

1. Integrating SAP with a CRM

  • Send customer details to Salesforce or HubSpot using POST calls.

2. Fetching Live Data

  • Retrieve stock prices, exchange rates, or weather details in real time.

3. Automating External Processes

  • Send purchase order confirmations to vendor portals.

4. Connecting SAP to Cloud Applications

  • Use REST APIs to integrate SAP with cloud apps, chatbots, mobile apps, and dashboards.

Conclusion

  • In modern SAP landscapes, REST APIs are not just a concept‚Äîthey are a necessity.

As an ABAP developer, understanding APIs empowers you to:

  • Build smarter integrations
  • Automate cross-platform workflows
  • Connect SAP with the outside world
  • Stay aligned with SAP‚Äôs shift toward cloud and digital transformation
  • This blog sets the foundation.

Stay tuned for Part 2 of the API series!

Your feedback and suggestions are always welcome. üòä

entry.title: INTRO TO REST API IN SAP ABAP.
entry.content:
REST API in SAP ABAP ‚Äì A Complete Developer-Friendly Guide (Part 2)

By: Nidhi Patekar

üîπ Introduction

  • This blog is Part 2 of my series on understanding APIs in SAP ABAP.

In Part 1, we explored:

‚úî What is an API

‚úî Why we use APIs

‚úî Basic concepts of communication between systems

In this Part 2, we will dive into the world of REST APIs, understand how they work, how SAP uses them, and how ABAP developers interact with REST principles through OData, CRUD operations, DPC methods, and RAP.

This blog is written in simple language and is ideal for:

  • ABAP beginners
  • Developers working on SAP‚Äìnon-SAP integrations
  • Students learning API concepts
  • SAP professionals working on Fiori / RAP / OData services

üöÄ Understanding REST API

What is REST API?

  • REST stands for Representational State Transfer.
  • It is a lightweight, scalable, stateless architectural style used to build web services.
  • A REST API allows two systems to communicate using standard HTTP methods such as:

GET ‚Äì Read data

POST ‚Äì Create new data

PUT ‚Äì Update an entire record

PATCH ‚Äì Partially update a record

DELETE ‚Äì Remove a record

  • REST APIs mostly exchange data in JSON format, making them modern and easy to integrate with mobile/web applications.

ü•ó Simple Analogy ‚Äì API as a Waiter

To understand this better, imagine a restaurant:

REST Concept Restaurant Example

  • Client You
  • Request Giving an order
  • API Waiter who carries your order
  • Server Kitchen
  • Data Prepared food
  • Response Food delivered back to you
  • The waiter (API) ensures proper communication between you (the client) and the kitchen (the server).

üåê How REST API Works (SAP Context)

  • A client sends a request like:
  • GET /SalesOrders('SO1234')
  • SAP receives the request ‚Üí executes backend ABAP logic ‚Üí sends back data in JSON/XML format.
  • REST API = Request (URL + Method) + Response (Data + Status Code)

üß© Why REST API is Used in SAP?

  • REST APIs are the backbone of modern SAP integration.

They are used to:

‚úî Transfer data between SAP and non-SAP systems

‚úî Build lightweight mobile or web apps

‚úî Connect SAP to cloud services

‚úî Power SAP Fiori applications

‚úî Enable RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model)

‚úî Expose SAP business data securely

üìå Understanding HTTP Methods With SAP Examples:

  • REST APIs use HTTP methods to perform CRUD operations.
  • Below is each method explained with real SAP ABAP examples.

1Ô∏è‚É£ GET ‚Äì Retrieve Data

  • Used for reading data from SAP backend.

Example Request:

  • GET /SalesOrders('SO1234')

üìå SAP Functionality: Fetch Sales Order details

üìå ABAP Implementation (OData):

  • Handled inside GET_ENTITY or GET_ENTITYSET methods of DPC_EXT.

Usage in SAP:

  • Fiori List Reports
  • Analytical apps
  • External systems fetching SAP master data

2Ô∏è‚É£ POST ‚Äì Create Data

  • Used for creating new entries.

Example Request:

POST /Customers

{

  "CustomerName": "Ravi Traders",

  "City": "Pune",

  "Email": "ravi@example.com"

}

 

üìå SAP Output: New customer is created.

üìå ABAP Implementation:

Mapped to CREATE_ENTITY in DPC_EXT.

Used in:

  • Fiori Create screens
  • External apps creating orders/customers
  • B2B integrations

3Ô∏è‚É£ PUT ‚Äì Full Update

  • Replaces an entire record.

Example Request:

PUT /Materials('MAT001')

{

  "MaterialName": "Steel Rod",

  "Weight": "15kg",

  "Category": "Raw Material"

}

üìå SAP Output:

  • Material updated or created if not present.

üìå ABAP Implementation:

  • Handled by UPDATE_ENTITY.

4Ô∏è‚É£ PATCH ‚Äì Partial Update

  • Only specific fields are updated.

Example:

PATCH /SalesOrders('SO1234')

{

  "DeliveryDate": "2025-11-15"

}

üìå SAP Output:

  • Only the Delivery Date changes.

üìå ABAP Implementation:

  • Handled in UPDATE_ENTITY, with conditional logic.

5Ô∏è‚É£ DELETE ‚Äì Remove Data

Example:

  • DELETE /Customers('CUST789')

üìå SAP Output:

  • Customer record deleted.

üìå ABAP Implementation:

  • Mapped to DELETE_ENTITY.

üß† Mapping HTTP Methods to DPC Methods

  • HTTP Method Purpose DPC_EXT Method
  • GET Read data GET_ENTITY / GET_ENTITYSET
  • POST Create data CREATE_ENTITY
  • PUT / PATCH Update data UPDATE_ENTITY
  • DELETE Remove data DELETE_ENTITY

üß± What is DPC & DPC_EXT in SAP OData?

  • When you create an OData service in SEGW, SAP generates two key classes:

1Ô∏è‚É£ MPC ‚Äì Model Provider Class

Defines the data model:

  • Entity Types
  • Properties
  • Associations

2Ô∏è‚É£ DPC ‚Äì Data Provider Class

  • Contains the logic for CRUD operations.

Why DPC_EXT Exists?

  • SAP generates DPC automatically
  • You should never edit the base class
  • Instead, write custom logic in DPC_EXT

Example:

  • To customize GET_ENTITY, you override it in
  • ZCL_<project>_DPC_EXT

üìç Where Does SAP Use REST API Concepts?

  • Even though ABAP developers don‚Äôt always create ‚ÄúREST APIs‚Äù directly, REST architecture is everywhere:

‚úî SAP OData Services

  • OData is a REST-based protocol.

‚úî SAP Fiori Apps

  • Fiori UI consumes OData REST services.

‚úî SAP Cloud Integrations

  • REST ‚Üí CPI ‚Üí SAP.

‚úî RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model)

  • RAP automatically generates REST/OData services.

‚úî External System Integrations

  • Non-SAP ‚Üí REST ‚Üí SAP ABAP logic.

üîÑ What is OData?

  • OData (Open Data Protocol) is a REST-based protocol widely used by SAP.

OData allows:

  • CRUD operations
  • Metadata access
  • Standardized URLs
  • Easy integration with Fiori and UI5
  • Tools to create OData:
  • SEGW (classic)
  • RAP (modern)

üü¶ What is RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model)?

  • RAP is SAP‚Äôs latest and modern approach.

RAP includes:

  • CDS Views
  • Behaviors
  • Metadata annotations
  • Automatic OData service generation

Advantages:

  • Clean architecture
  • Reusable logic
  • Better performance
  • Cloud-ready development

‚öñ Difference: OData (Classic) vs RAP

  • Feature Classic OData (SEGW) RAP
  • Tool SEGW ADT (Eclipse
  • CRUD Logic DPC_EXT coding Behavior class
  • Data Model Manually defined CDS-driven
  • Use Case On-premise systems Cloud-ready apps
  • OData Generation Manual Automatic

üéØ Summary

In this Part 2 blog, we covered:

‚úî What REST API is

‚úî Why REST API is important in SAP ABAP

‚úî HTTP methods explained through SAP business examples

‚úî CRUD operations and their mapping to OData DPC methods

‚úî Importance of DPC & DPC_EXT classes

‚úî Where REST concepts are applied in SAP

‚úî Introduction to OData & RAP

Understanding REST API concepts is essential for SAP ABAP developers, especially in today‚Äôs environment where SAP must connect seamlessly with cloud platforms, mobile apps, and external systems.

entry.title: Updates on ODATA V2 Deprecation
entry.content:

Omkar

entry.title: CX_SADL_DUMP_APPL_MODEL_ERROR while sending GET Request to ODATA v4 with /IWBEP/IF_V4_DP_BASIC
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I am trying to create ODATA V4 as mentioned in SAP Note 2485370, So I created a custom entity in Eclipse and also a Class with below method implemented from interface /IWBEP/IF_V4_DP_BASIC. 

@EndUserText.label: 'ZSAMPLE_SERVICE'
@ObjectModel.query.implementedBy: 'ABAP:ZCL_SAMPLE_SERVICE'
define custom entity ZSAMPLE_SERVICE
{
   key component_material : abap.char(40);
       fg_material  : abap.char(40);
       fg_material_descr : abap.char(40);
  
}

And Class as below

CLASS ZCL_SAMPLE_SERVICE DEFINITION
  PUBLIC
  inheriting from /iwbep/cx_gateway
  FINAL
  CREATE PUBLIC .

  PUBLIC SECTION.

    INTERFACES /IWBEP/IF_V4_DP_BASIC.
  PROTECTED SECTION.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
ENDCLASS.



CLASS ZCL_SAMPLE_SERVICE IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD /IWBEP/IF_V4_DP_BASIC~CREATE_ENTITY.

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD /IWBEP/IF_V4_DP_BASIC~CREATE_REFERENCE.

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD /IWBEP/IF_V4_DP_BASIC~DELETE_ENTITY.

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD /IWBEP/IF_V4_DP_BASIC~EXECUTE_ACTION.

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD /IWBEP/IF_V4_DP_BASIC~EXECUTE_FUNCTION.

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD /IWBEP/IF_V4_DP_BASIC~READ_ENTITY.

    DATA: TS_DATA TYPE zsample_service.
    TS_DATA-COMPONENT_MATERIAL = '12333333'.
    TS_DATA-FG_MATERIAL = '321'.
    TS_DATA-FG_MATERIAL_DESCR = 'This is material description'.


    IO_RESPONSE->SET_BUSI_DATA( TS_DATA ).
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD /IWBEP/IF_V4_DP_BASIC~READ_ENTITY_LIST.
    DATA: TS_DATA TYPE zsample_service,
          TT_DATA TYPE TABLE OF zsample_service.
    TS_DATA-COMPONENT_MATERIAL = '12333333'.
    TS_DATA-FG_MATERIAL = '321'.
    TS_DATA-FG_MATERIAL_DESCR = 'This is material description'.
    APPEND TS_DATA TO TT_DATA.
    IO_RESPONSE->SET_BUSI_DATA( TT_DATA[] ).
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD /IWBEP/IF_V4_DP_BASIC~READ_REF_TARGET_KEY_DATA.

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD /IWBEP/IF_V4_DP_BASIC~READ_REF_TARGET_KEY_DATA_LIST.

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD /IWBEP/IF_V4_DP_BASIC~UPDATE_ENTITY.

  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

After this, I created service definition to explose above cds entity and then service binding.

When I do Get request to my service URL from postman I am  getting dump saying as below

Error analysis                                                                                    |
|    The application has indicated exception "CX_SADL_DUMP_APPL_MODEL_ERROR" as the                |
|     reason for the                                                                               |
|    termination:                                                                                  |
|    Processing was aborted because of an application modeling error: See previous                 |
|    in exception chain.                                                                           |
|                                                                                                  |
|    The exception is related to the previous exception                                            |
|     "LCX_RAP_QUERY_PROV_BAD_IMPLMNT" that occurred in                                            |
|    program "CL_SADL_UNMANAGED_QUERY_ENGINECP", in line 6 of include                              |
|     "CL_SADL_UNMANAGED_QUERY_ENGINECM00J". The reason for this exception                         |
|    was:                                                                                          |
|    Error occurred during execution of query provider 'ZCL_SAMPLE_SERVICE'                        |
|                                                                                                  |
|    The exception is related to the previous exception                                            |
|     "CX_RAP_QUERY_PROV_CONSTRUCTION" that occurred in                                            |
|    program "CL_RAP_QUERY_PROVIDER_FACTORY=CP", in line 6 of include                              |
|     "CL_RAP_QUERY_PROVIDER_FACTORY=CM004". The reason for this exception                         |
|    was:                                                                                          |
|    Error during construction of the Unmanaged Query Provider for entity                          |
|    ZSAMPLE_SERVICE                                                                               |
|                                                                                                  |
|    The exception is related to the previous exception "CX_SY_CREATE_OBJECT_ERROR"                |
|     that occurred in                                                                             |
|    program "CL_RAP_QUERY_PROVIDER_FACTORY=CP", in line 3 of include                              |
|     "CL_RAP_QUERY_PROVIDER_FACTORY=CM004". The reason for this exception                         |
|    was:                                                                                          |
|    Could not create object; reference variable does not match specified class                    |
|    ZCL_SAMPLE_SERVICE.

Can anyone help on this?

I appreciate your time and reply on this query.

Regards,

Omkar

entry.title: Service Layer no longer creates Draft / Approval for Documents (returns 201 instead of Draft)
entry.content:
Hello,

SAP Business One 10.0 version for SAP HANA (10.00.290) SP 2505 (64-bit) / Service Layer, we noticed a change in behavior when creating Sales Quotations via Service Layer.

Scenario

  • SAP Business One 10.0 (HANA)

  • Approval procedure active for Sales Quotations

  • Approval works correctly in SAP B1 client

Previous behavior
POST /b1s/v2/Quotations

  • Returned 404

  • Location header pointed to /Drafts(<DocEntry>)

  • Draft (ODRF) created and approval triggered

Current behavior

  • Returns 201 Created

  • Location points to /Quotations(<DocEntry>)

  • Final document is created

  • No draft / no approval triggered

Question

  • Is this a known change or limitation in newer Service Layer versions?

  • Is approval-based draft creation no longer supported via Service Layer?

  • Is creating drafts explicitly via /b1s/v2/Drafts now the only supported approach?

Any official confirmation or SAP Note reference would be appreciated.

Thank you.

entry.title: Dual line chart using macros and odata v4
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I am facing some problems to implement a chart in Fiori, using macros, xml annotations and odata v4. It works when I only have one dimension, but fails when the second is included.

The annotation "@Aggregation.default: #SUM" is included in the entity view, and the xml annotation is being used as follow:

<edmx:Edmx xmlns:edmx="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edmx" Version="4.0">
    <edmx:Reference Uri="https://sap.github.io/odata-vocabularies/vocabularies/Analytics.xml">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.Analytics.v1" Alias="Analytics"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="https://oasis-tcs.github.io/odata-vocabularies/vocabularies/Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.xml">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="Org.OData.Aggregation.V1" Alias="Aggregation"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="https://sap.github.io/odata-vocabularies/vocabularies/Common.xml">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1" Alias="Common"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="https://oasis-tcs.github.io/odata-vocabularies/vocabularies/Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.xml">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1" Alias="Capabilities"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="https://sap.github.io/odata-vocabularies/vocabularies/HTML5.xml">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.HTML5.v1" Alias="HTML5"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="https://sap.github.io/odata-vocabularies/vocabularies/UI.xml">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1" Alias="UI"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata4/sap/zui_newblick/srvd/sap/zsd_newblick/0001/$metadata">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.gateway.srvd.zsd_newblick.v0001" Alias="SAP__self"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:DataServices>
        <Schema xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Namespace="local">

            <Annotations Target="SAP__self.Container/ZI_BLK_OPEN_RESOLVED">
                <Annotation Term="Aggregation.ApplySupported">
                    <Record Type="Aggregation.ApplySupportedType">
                        <PropertyValue Property="Transformations">
                            <Collection>
                                <String>aggregate</String>
                                <String>groupby</String>
                            </Collection>
                        </PropertyValue>
                        <PropertyValue Property="AggregatableProperties">
                            <Collection>
                                <Record Type="Aggregation.AggregatablePropertyType">
                                    <PropertyValue Property="Property">
                                        <PropertyPath>openTickets</PropertyPath>
                                    </PropertyValue>
                                </Record>
                                <Record Type="Aggregation.AggregatablePropertyType">
                                    <PropertyValue Property="Property">
                                        <PropertyPath>resolvedTickets</PropertyPath>
                                    </PropertyValue>
                                </Record>
                            </Collection>
                        </PropertyValue>
                        <PropertyValue Property="GroupableProperties">
                            <Collection>
                                <PropertyPath>openResolvedDate</PropertyPath>
                            </Collection>
                        </PropertyValue>
                    </Record>
                </Annotation>
            </Annotations>

            <Annotations Target="SAP__self.ZI_BLK_OPEN_RESOLVEDType">
                
                <Annotation Term="UI.Chart" Qualifier="TicketsOpenResolved">
					<Record Type="UI.ChartDefinitionType">
						<PropertyValue Property="Title" String="Open x Resolved" />
						<PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="UI.ChartType/Line" />
						<PropertyValue Property="Description" String="Open x Resolved Tickets" />
                        <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
							<Collection>
								<PropertyPath>openResolvedDate</PropertyPath>
							</Collection>
						</PropertyValue>
                        <PropertyValue Property="DimensionAttributes">
							<Collection>
								<Record Type="UI.ChartDimensionAttributeType">
									<PropertyValue Property="Dimension" PropertyPath="openResolvedDate" />
									<PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="UI.ChartDimensionRoleType/Category" />
								</Record>
							</Collection>
						</PropertyValue>
                        <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
                            <Collection>
                                <PropertyPath>openTickets</PropertyPath>
                                <PropertyPath>resolvedTickets</PropertyPath>
                            </Collection>
                        </PropertyValue>
                        <PropertyValue Property="DynamicMeasures">
                            <Collection>
                                <AnnotationPath>@Analytics.AggregatedProperty</AnnotationPath>
                                <AnnotationPath>@Analytics.AggregatedProperty#ResolvedSum</AnnotationPath>
                            </Collection>
                        </PropertyValue>
						<PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
							<Collection>
								<Record Type="UI.ChartMeasureAttributeType">
									<PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="openTickets" />
									<PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="UI.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
								</Record>
                                <Record Type="UI.ChartMeasureAttributeType">
                                    <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="resolvedTickets" />
                                    <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="UI.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
                                </Record>
							</Collection>
						</PropertyValue>
						
					</Record>
				</Annotation>

                <Annotation Term="Analytics.AggregatedProperty">
                    <Record Type="Analytics.AggregatedPropertyType" >
                        <PropertyValue Property="Name" String="openSum"/>
                        <PropertyValue Property="AggregationMethod" String="sum"/>
                        <PropertyValue Property="AggregatableProperty" PropertyPath="openTickets"/>
                        <Annotation Term="Common.Label" String="Open Tickets"/>
                    </Record>
                </Annotation>
                <Annotation Term="Analytics.AggregatedProperty" Qualifier="ResolvedSum" >
                    <Record Type="Analytics.AggregatedPropertyType">
                        <PropertyValue Property="Name" String="resolvedSum"/>
                        <PropertyValue Property="AggregationMethod" String="sum"/>
                        <PropertyValue Property="AggregatableProperty" PropertyPath="resolvedTickets"/>
                        <Annotation Term="Common.Label" String="Resolved Tickets"/>
                    </Record>
                </Annotation>

            </Annotations>

        </Schema>
    </edmx:DataServices>
</edmx:Edmx>

The chart opens with the message "To start, set the relevant filters and choose "Go" when even there isn't any filter to be applied. 

Its associated batch call returns the errors:  "Dynamic property 'openSum' not provided by provider application", "Property 'openSum' not found". The attribute in the backend entity is openTickets, and the aggregated property in the xml annotation is "openSum", which doesn't fail with only one dimension, but It does fail with two. 

<Annotation Term="Analytics.AggregatedProperty">
                    <Record Type="Analytics.AggregatedPropertyType" >
                        <PropertyValue Property="Name" String="openSum"/>
                        <PropertyValue Property="AggregationMethod" String="sum"/>
                        <PropertyValue Property="AggregatableProperty" PropertyPath="openTickets"/>
                        <Annotation Term="Common.Label" String="Open Tickets"/>
                    </Record>
                </Annotation>
                <Annotation Term="Analytics.AggregatedProperty" Qualifier="ResolvedSum" >
                    <Record Type="Analytics.AggregatedPropertyType">
                        <PropertyValue Property="Name" String="resolvedSum"/>
                        <PropertyValue Property="AggregationMethod" String="sum"/>
                        <PropertyValue Property="AggregatableProperty" PropertyPath="resolvedTickets"/>
                        <Annotation Term="Common.Label" String="Resolved Tickets"/>
                    </Record>
                </Annotation>

What could be wrong in my xml annotation?

entry.title: Add a custom field to the app "Stock - Multiple Materials" (F1595)
entry.content:
Hello folks,

we'd like to extend the app "Stock - Multiple Materials" (F1595) to a custom field which is stored in the MARC table. This field is in an append to the MARC table and in the customer namespace. It should be displayed in the result table of the app.

Is this possible without a modification on the ODATA layer?  

If yes, could you please advice how this is done? 

 

We really appreciate your support!

Best regards,

Chris

entry.title: Insert a New Row into table at a specific Index using Odata v4
entry.content:
Hi Forum,

I have an issue , Please help me in resolving it!!!

When I am trying to create a row with the following code:

// Get the list binding from the table's "items" aggregation
var oListBinding = oTable.getBinding("items");
var oInitialData = {
"site": "1000",
"storage_location":"1234",
"article_doc_num": "1234",
"article_doc_num_itm":"1"
};
// Create a new entry (context)
var oNewContext = oListBinding.create(oInitialData);

The new row is getting created at the beginning of the table, but I want the row to be added at a specific index.


Please suggest a solution for this.

entry.title: Unable to Deploy Joules Skills in SAP BPA - ClientNotFound
entry.content:
Hello, I have an error when I try to deploy or test Joule in SAP BPA.

"The project cannot be deployed by the component "Integration Gateway". Error while trying to connect to Joule - JouleClientService - invalid_client - Client Not Found"

I have the roles for das-application but it still doesn't reaches. Also, when I try to test, the environments don't show up. 

Here some examples:
